results.description: Core: measure recent earnings surprise relative to history. Applied SUGGESTION1 by using both actual and estimated EPS; SUGGESTION2 not applied (fields not vector); SUGGESTION3 not needed (coverage >0.6); SUGGESTION4 applied (high user/alpha counts for anl4_epsr_value). Kept implementation short and <=2 datafields. Confidence set to 0.88 based on strong coverage and broad usage.

Core: momentum in number of upper estimations indicates improving analyst sentiment. Applied SUGGESTION1 (use count field), SUGGESTION2 not applicable, SUGGESTION3 not needed (coverage 0.6979), SUGGESTION4 applied (high user/alpha counts). Implementation short. Confidence 0.76.

Core: rising number of lower estimations signals potential weakness. Followed SUGGESTION1; SUGGESTION3 not required (coverage >0.6); SUGGESTION4 used (large user/alphaCount). Kept operators minimal. Confidence 0.72.

Core: abnormal divergence between EBITDA and EBIT may reveal unusual adjustments. Used both anl4_ebitda_value and anl4_ebit_value per SUGGESTION1; both have good coverage and user counts so SUGGESTION4 applied. No ts_backfill needed. Confidence 0.70.

results.idea: Free cash flow per share improvement

Core: increase in anl4_mark (recommendation consensus score) implies positive re-rating. Applied SUGGESTION1 and SUGGESTION4 (anl4_mark has good userCount). Confidence 0.67.
